db:abstract.db:para: The QVector3D class represents a vector or vertex in 3D space.

db:listitem.db:para: QVector3D is part of Rendering in 3D

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Vectors are one of the main building blocks of 3D representation and drawing. They consist of three coordinates, traditionally called x, y, and z.
The QVector3D class can also be used to represent vertices in 3D space. We therefore do not need to provide a separate vertex class.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D::QVector3D()
db:section.db:para: Constructs a null vector, i.e. with coordinates (0, 0, 0).

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D::QVector3D(float xpos, float ypos, float zpos)

db:constructorsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QVector3D(float xpos, float ypos, float zpos)

db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with coordinates (xpos, ypos, zpos).

db:section.db:title: [explicit constexpr] QVector3D::QVector3D(QPoint point)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with x and y coordinates from a 2D point, and a z coordinate of 0.

db:section.db:title: [explicit constexpr] QVector3D::QVector3D(QPointF point)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a vector with x and y coordinates from a 2D point, and a z coordinate of 0.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D::QVector3D(QVector2D vector)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a 3D vector from the specified 2D vector. The z coordinate is set to zero.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D::QVector3D(QVector2D vector, float zpos)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a 3D vector from the specified 2D vector. The z coordinate is set to zpos.

db:section.db:title: [explicit constexpr] QVector3D::QVector3D(QVector4D vector)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a 3D vector from the specified 4D vector. The w coordinate is dropped.

db:section.db:title: [static constexpr] QVector3D QVector3D::crossProduct(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns the cross-product of vectors v1 and v2, which corresponds to the normal vector of a plane defined by v1 and v2.

db:section.db:title: float QVector3D::distanceToLine(QVector3D point, QVector3D direction) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: float distanceToLine(QVector3D point, QVector3D direction) const

db:section.db:para: Returns the distance that this vertex is from a line defined by point and the unit vector direction.
If direction is a null vector, then it does not define a line. In that case, the distance from point to this vertex is returned.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] float QVector3D::distanceToPlane(QVector3D plane, QVector3D normal) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: float distanceToPlane(QVector3D plane, QVector3D normal) const

db:section.db:para: Returns the distance from this vertex to a plane defined by the vertex plane and a normal unit vector. The normal parameter is assumed to have been normalized to a unit vector.
The return value will be negative if the vertex is below the plane, or zero if it is on the plane.

db:section.db:title: float QVector3D::distanceToPlane(QVector3D plane1, QVector3D plane2, QVector3D plane3) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: float distanceToPlane(QVector3D plane1, QVector3D plane2, QVector3D plane3) const

db:section.db:para: Returns the distance from this vertex to a plane defined by the vertices plane1, plane2 and plane3.
The return value will be negative if the vertex is below the plane, or zero if it is on the plane.
The two vectors that define the plane are plane2 - plane1 and plane3 - plane1.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.1] float QVector3D::distanceToPoint(QVector3D point) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the distance from this vertex to a point defined by the vertex point.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.1.

db:section.db:title: [static constexpr] float QVector3D::dotProduct(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns the dot product of v1 and v2.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] bool QVector3D::isNull() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the x, y, and z coordinates are set to 0.0, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: float QVector3D::length() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the length of the vector from the origin.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] float QVector3D::lengthSquared() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the squared length of the vector from the origin. This is equivalent to the dot product of the vector with itself.

db:section.db:title: [static] QVector3D QVector3D::normal(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns the normal vector of a plane defined by vectors v1 and v2, normalized to be a unit vector.
Use crossProduct() to compute the cross-product of v1 and v2 if you do not need the result to be normalized to a unit vector.

db:section.db:title: [static] QVector3D QVector3D::normal(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2, QVector3D v3)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QVector3D normal(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2, QVector3D v3)

db:section.db:para: Returns the normal vector of a plane defined by vectors v2 - v1 and v3 - v1, normalized to be a unit vector.
Use crossProduct() to compute the cross-product of v2 - v1 and v3 - v1 if you do not need the result to be normalized to a unit vector.

db:section.db:title: void QVector3D::normalize()
db:section.db:para: Normalizes the currect vector in place. Nothing happens if this vector is a null vector or the length of the vector is very close to 1.

db:section.db:title: QVector3D QVector3D::normalized() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the normalized unit vector form of this vector.

If this vector is null, then a null vector is returned. If the length of the vector is very close to 1, then the vector will be returned as-is. Otherwise the normalized form of the vector of length 1 will be returned.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] QVector3D QVector3D::project(const QMatrix4x4 &modelView, const QMatrix4x4 &projection, const QRect &viewport) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QVector3D project(const QMatrix4x4 &modelView, const QMatrix4x4 &projection, const QRect &viewport) const

db:section.db:para: Returns the window coordinates of this vector initially in object/model coordinates using the model view matrix modelView, the projection matrix projection and the viewport dimensions viewport.
When transforming from clip to normalized space, a division by the w component on the vector components takes place. To prevent dividing by 0 if w equals to 0, it is set to 1.

db:note.db:para: the returned y coordinates are in OpenGL orientation. OpenGL expects the bottom to be 0 whereas for Qt top is 0.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] void QVector3D::setX(float x)
db:section.db:para: Sets the x coordinate of this point to the given x coordinate.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] void QVector3D::setY(float y)
db:section.db:para: Sets the y coordinate of this point to the given y coordinate.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] void QVector3D::setZ(float z)
db:section.db:para: Sets the z coordinate of this point to the given z coordinate.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QPoint QVector3D::toPoint() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QPoint form of this 3D vector. The z coordinate is dropped.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QPointF QVector3D::toPointF() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the QPointF form of this 3D vector. The z coordinate is dropped.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector2D QVector3D::toVector2D() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 2D vector form of this 3D vector, dropping the z coordinate.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector4D QVector3D::toVector4D() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 4D form of this 3D vector, with the w coordinate set to zero.

db:section.db:title: [since 5.5] QVector3D QVector3D::unproject(const QMatrix4x4 &modelView, const QMatrix4x4 &projection, const QRect &viewport) const

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QVector3D unproject(const QMatrix4x4 &modelView, const QMatrix4x4 &projection, const QRect &viewport) const

db:section.db:para: Returns the object/model coordinates of this vector initially in window coordinates using the model view matrix modelView, the projection matrix projection and the viewport dimensions viewport.
When transforming from clip to normalized space, a division by the w component of the vector components takes place. To prevent dividing by 0 if w equals to 0, it is set to 1.

db:note.db:para: y coordinates in viewport should use OpenGL orientation. OpenGL expects the bottom to be 0 whereas for Qt top is 0.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] float QVector3D::x() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the x coordinate of this point.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] float QVector3D::y() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the y coordinate of this point.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] float QVector3D::z() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the z coordinate of this point.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QVector3D::operator QVariant() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the 3D vector as a QVariant.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D &QVector3D::operator*=(float factor)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies this vector's coordinates by the given factor, and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D &QVector3D::operator*=(QVector3D vector)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Multiplies the components of this vector by the corresponding components in vector.
Note: this is not the same as the crossProduct() of this vector and vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D &QVector3D::operator+=(QVector3D vector)
db:section.db:para: Adds the given vector to this vector and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D &QVector3D::operator-=(QVector3D vector)
db:section.db:para: Subtracts the given vector from this vector and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D &QVector3D::operator/=(float divisor)
db:section.db:para: Divides this vector's coordinates by the given divisor, and returns a reference to this vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 5.5] QVector3D &QVector3D::operator/=(QVector3D vector)
db:section.db:para: Divides the components of this vector by the corresponding components in vector.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 5.2] float &QVector3D::operator[](int i)
db:section.db:para: Returns the component of the vector at index position i as a modifiable reference.
i must be a valid index position in the vector (i.e., 0 <= i < 3).
This function was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 5.2] float QVector3D::operator[](int i) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the component of the vector at index position i.
i must be a valid index position in the vector (i.e., 0 <= i < 3).
This function was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: bool qFuzzyCompare(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if v1 and v2 are equal, allowing for a small fuzziness factor for floating-point comparisons; false otherwise.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] bool operator!=(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if v1 is not equal to v2; otherwise returns false. This operator uses an exact floating-point comparison.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D operator*(float factor, QVector3D vector)
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of the given vector, multiplied by the given factor.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D operator*(QVector3D vector, float factor)
db:section.db:para: Returns a copy of the given vector, multiplied by the given factor.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D operator*(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2)
db:section.db:para: Multiplies the components of v1 by the corresponding components in v2.

db:note.db:para: This is not the same as the crossProduct() of v1 and v2.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D operator+(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns a QVector3D object that is the sum of the given vectors, v1 and v2; each component is added separately.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D operator-(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns a QVector3D object that is formed by subtracting v2 from v1; each component is subtracted separately.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D operator-(QVector3D vector)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Returns a QVector3D object that is formed by changing the sign of all three components of the given vector.
Equivalent to QVector3D(0,0,0) - vector.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] QVector3D operator/(QVector3D vector, float divisor)
db:section.db:para: Returns the QVector3D object formed by dividing all three components of the given vector by the given divisor.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr, since 5.5] QVector3D operator/(QVector3D vector, QVector3D divisor)
db:section.db:para: Returns the QVector3D object formed by dividing components of the given vector by a respective components of the given divisor.
This function was introduced in Qt 5.5.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator<<(QDataStream &stream, QVector3D vector)
db:section.db:para: Writes the given vector to the given stream and returns a reference to the stream.

db:section.db:title: [constexpr] bool operator==(QVector3D v1, QVector3D v2)
db:section.db:para: Returns true if v1 is equal to v2; otherwise returns false. This operator uses an exact floating-point comparison.

db:section.db:title: QDataStream &operator>>(QDataStream &stream, QVector3D &vector)
db:section.db:para: Reads a 3D vector from the given stream into the given vector and returns a reference to the stream.
